at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.daemon.drivers.raspberrypii2cdemo

Class PortRpiI2c

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.daemon.drivers.PortCfg
      • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.daemon.drivers.raspberrypii2cdemo.PortRpiI2c

  • public class PortRpiI2c
extends PortCfg
    This Class represents the configuration of a Sensor/Actor - a Port - on an RaspberryPi I2C-Interface. The configuration is stored in a file formated in json. See the apidoc of class PortCfg, for the description of the general config parameters. The section hwCfg and the specific parameters for connection to devices on the I2C bus are described here. 
     { "portCfg" : [
    { ...
      "hwCfg" : {
              "connection" : "I2C",
              "i2cMuxAddr" : "0x70",
              "i2cMuxCmd"  : "0x04",
              "i2cAddr"    : "0x51",
              "bitWeight"  : "16,32,64,128,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1,2,4,8" },
      ...
      }
 ] }
    On an I2C bus multiple devices reside. Communication is structured as master-slave - a master start communication and a slave completes it. Each slave has a bus address assigned. A master has no address. The SDG acts as master only. In some cases a I2C multiplexer resides between the master and the slave. The I2C multiplexer must be propper set.
    • connection: I2C If the value of this parameter differs, this config is not assigned to the I2C driver - the whole entry will be ignored. This config is mandatory.
    • i2cMuxAddr: The address of the I2C multiplexer. This config is optional.
    • i2cMuxCmd: The command for the I2C multiplexer. This config is optional.
    • i2cAddr: The I2C address of the sensor device. This config is mandatory.
    • bitWeight: A list of weights. The number of entries defines the number of Bytes read from the sensor device. This config is optional - the default is: "1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128"

      • getValue

        byte[] getValue(com.pi4j.io.i2c.I2CBus i2cBus)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves the value from a sensor If a I2C multiplexer is defined, the multiplexer is propper set. Next the I2C device is read. The number of Bytes read are defined indirect by the number of elements in bitWeights
        Parameters:
        i2cBus - The I2C bus on which the I2C device resides.
        Returns:
        The Bytes received from the I2C device.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If some problems occured when reading form the I2C bus.
